Posts.Content: Oct 21, 2008 09:33AM kristifromsandiego wrote: Hello, My name is Kristi and I am new to all this chat room stuff.  I was diagnosed about the same time most on this web site seem to have been diagnosed.  I got the call on September 15th and had a one side mastectomy on October 7th.  18 nodes taken 2 bad.  I meet with the oncologist on Wednesday.  As it relates to your question, how long will you be off work will depend on how many nodes they take.  18 for me was a lot and 2 weeks out I can barely lift my arm above my waist.  My doctor will not let me drive.  I am hoping to drive maybe next week or within two weeks.  My doctor also is pushing for chemo to start within 3.5 weeks of surgery, seems fast but I guess I do not have much of an option.  Recovery takes much longer than I thought, and it is very boring!  I am trying to decide if I need to get a port for chemo because they can no longer use my right side because of surgery on nodes.  ANy suggestions anyone?  Kristi
Posts.Title: Received my diagnois tonight..IDC Lainey64 Lainey64

Posts.Content: Dec 6, 2008 07:51PM kristifromsandiego wrote: Mason, It is kind of funny that I am the opposite, I still, after chemo # 2 this past Monday am constipated.  I have taken so much stuff for it and am so crampy, I can't really go out of the house either.  It seems like it takes atleast a week before I can venture out. Unique, How did you get rid of the cold?  I am so scared to get one.  Someone told me if you get one you will have it the whole chemo adventure (4 months). ILovemykids, I am only taking iron through pills, do you know why they are giving you infusions, should I be concerned with this.....anybody else have to do this? Stay happy   Kristi

When does this exhaustion part go away, is there bone pain after that?.  They gave me the "shot Nuro.....something" immediately after my TAC infusions.  Are over the counter drugs good enough to help with the bone pain.  I need to drive my daughter an hour away on Saturday night then wait for her for two hours and take her back home, am I going to be able to do that?  Any comments?  Thank you Kristi

Posts.Content: Dec 19, 2008 01:10AM kristifromsandiego wrote: WOW you guys are sooooooolucky, Debk55 is done, Fanny is done, Kim is done, Unique is done, Rockfan has only one more and Lori gets a break......I must say I am a bit jealous, one day that will be me too.  I have chemo tomorrow and then again on the 12th of Jan, Feb 2 and Feb 23rd It seems like so far away.  I am so very very happy with you.  You are so lucky.  I would not wish this stuff on my worst enemy. Lori, it seems like you have been a very busy person, be careful not to over due, you don't want to get sick but you don't want this to rule your life either.  Unique, I hope you are feeling better?  It sounds like you got really sick, I am using hand sanitizer all the time.  It has been cold here so I even sign the charge slips at the stores with my gloves on. I have finished all my Christmas buying, wrapping and package sending.  I have to figure that I am not going to be doing much for the next 4/5 days.  I even bought a ham to cook for Christmas, all you have to do is put it in the oven. I hope that all of you have a great holiday and that the New Year brings you lots and lots of HAIR!  I still have a few strands in front so I am still not shaving it, I do look like a little old man if I take the hat off.   Have a good night  Kristi ....off to chemo in less than 12 hours...TAC here I come.

But I don't know how you can be so demanding on your body without it reacting and kicking you in the butt.  My body is not that strong, it has already told me to kick back and let others control what goes on.  I however have kids that are a lot older than you.  Just try to take care of yourself! There is only one of you.  Remember we care. Kristi

Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2008 02:49PM kristifromsandiego wrote: Joy and Lori, Thanks for the guidance.  I am a bit worried my oncologist is not going to let me start my first round of chemo.  I am having reconstruction and my incision has opened up when they filled me last time.  My PS wanted to get two fillings in before chemo started.  The hole is about the size of a dime and it is oozing but is not infected.  It is an open wound and I am changing the dressing and putting ointment on it 3 times a day.  Has this happened to anyone.  I am suppose to start drugs Sunday before chemo on Monday and don't want to, if the oncologist is going to say that he won't give me chemo on Monday with an open wound.  Any thoughts.  Thanks  Kristi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Nov 16, 2008 09:06PM kristifromsandiego wrote: Hello everyone, It has been a while since I posted.  I had chemo on Monday, so tomorrow will be one week.  I started feeling bad Wednesday night, since then things seems bad bad bad.  I have mouth sores, aches all over, constipation so bad I want to scream, my head aches, I am so tired.  I need help on a few things.  I am taking TAC every 3 weeks, this was my first chemo.  I cannot sleep, I have been taking ambein but it does nothing. I am awake every night for hours, I mean hours.  I have not slept more than 3 hours straight since Wednesday.  when I awake my mind just races, like I have been wide awake for hours. Suggestions? My constipation also hurts, I am trying, prunes, fiber, and water.  My doctor also wants me to take iron which is bad for constipation, but he says I need it for red blood cells.  Suggestions? I hurt all over, I thought it wold be gone by now, it has been just about a week.  I have been taking ibuprofen 2 tablets every 6 hours, should I get stronger stuff, isn't it bad for your liver. Thank you for all your help, I really really appreciate it and need it!  Kristi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2008 11:19PM kristifromsandiego wrote: You guys are wonderful.  I called my oncologist and he said slow down and start from the top.  He listened to all my symptoms, he was kind and endearing.  He said the first thing we have to take care of was the constipation.  He prescribed Miralax, on scoopful in some water or juice.  This is a miracle drug thus far.  It has only been about 8 hours but I feel so much better. Then my lack of sleep, he gave me Temazepam, and suggested I take a warm shower before bed, and do not read, watch TV or listen to music in bed.  Go there to sleep only.  So that is what I am going to do.  I can't wait, I feel confident that this will work.  EBAN -Also, this morning I must have cry ed for hours, about 11:45 I took a half an hour nap and then ate some lunch.  But what really changed my outlook was going outside.  The air was warm I got a bit tired, my intestines started to make noise.  Everything was better after that. Exercise is good.  My husband cryed tonight, he left me this morning when I was crying and said he will never do that again.  He is so very dear I am very lucky. Thank you Unique and Peeps for your insight, I do my second Chemo on Dec 1st.

Kristi

Posts.Content: Dec 10, 2008 12:37PM kristifromsandiego wrote: Unique, It is good to hear from you, It has been awhile.  So sorry about the cold. I am praying I do not get one.  I made my husband sleep in another bed the other night because he said he felt like he was coming down with one.  I also am missing most of the Christmas parties, I just do not want one. For those of you having constipation issues, I called my oncologist yesterday and he says "stay on the Miralax everyday for the next 3 months, that should eventually even you out.  So I am going to try it and see how it goes.  Right now my intestines wake me up at 5:30am every morning, during chemo they sleep for four days then I am in pain for about 5 more days after that.  Let's hope this works.  He also said, stay on my sleeping pill instead of trying to wean myself off it in between chemos.  He is a really nice man and tells me that this is so hard, and he is sorry that anyone has to go through it. I am going out today, yipee, hope I can make it without getting to tired.  I am bringing my hand sanitizer with me!  Have a good day.  Kristi

I also have been busy with the last weeks of school.  My son came home from college yesterday, it is so great to see him.  My daughter has finals this coming week then everyone is off until January 5th.  My kids will both be home to watch me go through chemo #3 of 6, so I hope it wond't be to hard on them or me.  I am not use to all the activity, usually the house is quiet.  We will just have to take one day at a time.  I also will be pretty bad for Christmas, but atleast the house is decorated.  I think even though it is a lot of work to put them up, it brings me joy. Hang in there everyone!  Kristi

Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2008 10:33PM kristifromsandiego wrote: Hi guys, Sounds like everyone is doing pretty well.  I would like to know how Unique's cold is going, she has not posted for a while, so she has me worried.  Ilovemykids, what's your first name?  I cry a ton the week after chemo  I think it is because it just makes you wasted.  You are so tired of fighting.  Then I get better the next week.  I must go through a whole box of Kleenex.  I found that it is best to schedule people to come visit you when you think these times are going to be.  I think having people are distracts you from feeling sorry for your self, not that I don't think we deserve to cry but mine was getting out of hand.  Now I plan for someone to visit me once a day for 5 days after chemo.  Even if they stay for only 15 minutes, it at least distracts me.    Lori, so sorry to hear about the port, I don't know anything about them.  I get my chemo every 3 weeks so they have done it through my veins, hopefully they will stay strong!  Take care  Kristi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Jan 1, 2009 11:15AM kristifromsandiego wrote: Happy New Years as well, at least I have no hang over!  Went to bed at 10:30pm, feel a lot better than some of those wild party animals!  I am going to one of those next year.  Happy New Year.....my fingers are sore just writing this, wonder whats next.  Kristi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2009 12:42AM kristifromsandiego wrote: Cheryl, I am so sorry for you.  I think one of the key reasons for depression is lack of sleep.  I had it really bad with my first treatment.  My oncologist changed my sleeping pills and told me only to get in my bed when I wanted to sleep, no reading or watching TV.  Now I have a whole routine, I do all my evening stuff, brush teeth, mouthwash, etc., then I take a warm shower to regulate my body heat then I go to bed and turn off the light.  I can usually go to sleep then I wake up around 2 or 3am to go to the bathroom.  Sometimes I can go back to sleep for 1 hour at a time after that.  But the key is to get at least 5 hours of straight sleep. I think I would call your oncologist and see if he couldn't do something else to help you.  Don't worry about the kids, they are probably really happy.  Mine too are sitting around a ton watching TV.   They will be OK. Just take care of yourself.  We are here for you!  I hope you are better. Kristi
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Mar 13, 2009 12:07AM kristifromsandiego wrote: Hi Unique, I also remember this list in its heyday.  I am glad that most people on it are off living life again. I am finished with chemo (Feb 23) and will be mapped for rads on the 17th.  I am living a lot until then.  It is amazing even with the weeping eyes, the numb fingers, the weakness, the bald head, life seems pretty normal.  I am just so glad to have chemo behind me.  I pray that I will not see it ever again. Hope all is good with you!  Kristi

Posts.Content: Nov 10, 2008 03:46PM kristifromsandiego wrote: I also had a hemotoma, mine fortunately drained over time, but it took awhile.  In fact both of my breast felt like I was engorged with milk for about 3 weeks after surgery, and I only had a right mastectomy.  My "good" breast still hurts from time to time, I thin it is being sympathetic to the right.  It is amazing how smart we have come with terminology that we new very little about just months ago.  I appreciate these discussion.  I start chemo for the first time this morning.  I am ready and I just want it to begin.  I look forward to talking with all of you as this proceeds.  Good luck to all. Kristi
Posts.Title: 2 questions jillisucat jillisucat

Posts.Content: Nov 10, 2008 03:50PM kristifromsandiego wrote: Forgot one thing.  Make sure someone else always checks your drugs for you, I nearly took one when I was suppose to take another.  I am a college educated graduate, ex corporate exec,a nd a wife and mother, you'd think I could read the bottle, but your mind gets a little foggy.  Talk soon Kristi
Posts.Title: 2 questions jillisucat jillisucat

Posts.Content: Nov 12, 2008 04:14AM kristifromsandiego wrote: Hi guys,  So nice to hear from all of you.  I got chemo for the first time yesterday.  I am happy to say that yesterday was uneventful.  They gave me decardon to take on Sunday which just made me hyper but pretty happy, I could have put a roof on.  They when I got there they gave me benadryl which made me really calm.  I got TAC (three drugs)  the T is the one they worry you might react to which I did'nt. The whole thing took about 3 hours because they wanted to explain things to us, I slept the 45 minutes back to our house where I took a 2 hour nap.  The nurse was great, got me with one prick of the needle piece of cake.  I expect to hit the wall tomorrow, hopefully just a little wall.   Jill when I went in for my MRI it initially showed that that I had things in both breasts, but after an MRI biopsy a week later it showed only in one breast. So don't get worried until after all ALL your results are in.  I only had a single mastectomy which was really OK, it just takes a while to find that place where your mind can rest a bit. Deb, good luck tomorrow, hopefully yours will be as uneventful as mine was, at least so far. Let me know how yours goes.  What drugs are they giving you.   My bathroom looks like I am a drug addict (7 prescriptions). Kathi, Thank you for all your thoughts, how has the hair thing been going?  I am expecting to loose mine before Thanksgiving. What a drag. Peace to all - sleep well....Kristi
Posts.Title: 2 questions jillisucat jillisucat

Posts.Content: Jul 6, 2009 06:35PM kristifromsandiego wrote: Hello Everyone, You are all very brave.  You will survive this and be stronger on the other end.  I wanted to remember what it was all about, I completed all treatment chemo and radiation in May.  You will meet people in this site that will be your friends for years to come.  Three of us from different parts of the states are meeting in September.  I would have never met them if it weren't for breast cancer.  So for how terrible this is, good things do come from it.  Keep your spirits high, drink lots of water, try to walk whenever possible, there is life after treatment.   Kristi
